title: Provides for protection of essential habitats of endangered and threatened species
summary: Provides for the protection of habitats of endangered and threatened species by directing the department of environmental conservation to designate essential habitats of such species and to regulate activities affecting such habitats; defines the term "essential habitat"; provides procedures for the designation by such department of essential habitats of threatened or endangered species; provides for public hearings and preliminary designations of essential habitats; promulgates regulations governing the designation of such habitats; requires such department to promulgate specific guidelines, standards and criteria that directly relate to each area; provides for real property tax abatement authorizations for such designated areas.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  environmental  conservation law, in relation to
         protecting essential habitats of endangered and threatened species

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  legislature  hereby  finds  and  declares  that  the
    2  protection  and  perpetuation  of  endangered  and  threatened   species
    3  contribute significantly to the general welfare of the state; endangered
    4  and  threatened  species  provide  ecological,  educational, scientific,
    5  aesthetic, and public health benefits. Habitat damage or destruction  is
    6  a  primary  cause  of species' becoming endangered or threatened. Unless
    7  protective measures are taken, additional species may become  extirpated
    8  or extinct.
    9    It  is  further declared to be the policy of the state and the purpose
   10  of this legislation to conserve endangered and  threatened  species  and
   11  species  of  special  concern  by  protecting their habitats on publicly
   12  owned land.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1889

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to
protecting essential habitats of endangered and threatened species

PURPOSE:
To amend the ECL section 11-0535 to provide for the protection of
habitats of endangered and threatened species by directing the
Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) to designate essential
habitats of such species and to regulate activities affecting such
habitats.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would: (1) add a definition of "essential habitat" to ECL
section 11-0535; (2) provide procedures for the designation by the
DEC of essential habitats of threatened or endangered species; (3)
provide for public hearings and preliminary designations of essential
habitats; (4) promulgate regulations governing the designation of
these areas; (5) require DEC to promulgate specific guidelines,
standards and criteria that directly relate to each area; (6) provide
for written notice, public hearings, and limitation of owner activity
after designation; and (7) provide for real property tax abatement
authorizations.

EXISTING LAW:

JUSTIFICATION:
The perpetuation and protection of endangered and threatened species
is important to the general welfare of the State. Many of these
species provide ecological, educational, scientific and recreational
benefits to our citizens. Existing law does not provide adequate
protection for them.
By enacting this bill, the intent is not to replicate lengthy
proceeding, but to provide for swift and direct procedures to protect
our endangered and threatened wildlife. Furthermore, by requiring the
DEC to consider each site every five years, a mechanism is provided
for the removal from the list of species, those species which have
relocated or are no longer endangered.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
03/16/09 REFERRED TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION
01/06/10 REFERRED TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeeding
the date on which it shall have become a law.
